definition:
An *invariant polynomial* is a polynomial $P$ that is invariant under a
Lie group $\Gamma$ acting on a vector space $V$. Therefore $P$ is
$\Gamma$-invariant polynomial if $P(\gamma x) = P(x)$ for all
$\gamma \in \Gamma$ and $x \in V$.

[1]{} Golubitsky, Martin. Stewart, Ian. Schaeffer, G. David:
Singularities and Groups in Bifurcation Theory *(Volume II)*.
Springer-Verlag, New York, 1988.
